technician_availability.description: Available time slots for technician visits over the next 7 days

appointment_scenarios.reason_for_visit: Customer has local outage confirmed, network equipment needs physical inspection and possible replacement
appointment_scenarios.notes: Local outage affecting address 123 Maple St. Backend shows modem signal loss. May need outside line check.

appointment_scenarios.reason_for_visit: Modem completely offline, 100% packet loss, no power/connectivity detected. Hardware replacement likely needed.
appointment_scenarios.notes: Critical failure - modem not responding at all. Customer reports no lights on device. Possible power supply or hardware failure.

appointment_scenarios.reason_for_visit: Persistent network issues with 20-40% packet loss despite reset attempts. Line quality check needed.
appointment_scenarios.notes: Customer experiencing severe packet loss and high latency. Network reset attempted but issues persist. May need line repair or equipment upgrade.

helpdesk_scenarios.description: All system checks pass but customer claims no internet
helpdesk_scenarios.diagnostic_summary: Modem: solid white LED (functional), Network: 0% packet loss, excellent ping results, No outages: local or regional, Plan: active and paid, Backend config: all systems normal
helpdesk_scenarios.escalation_reason: All automated diagnostics show normal operation, but customer reports persistent connectivity issues. Human expert needed to investigate potential edge cases: device-specific issues, DNS problems, browser/app configuration, WiFi password mismatch, VPN conflicts, or ISP-level routing problems not visible to standard diagnostics.
recommended_next_steps: Verify customer is connecting to correct WiFi network
Check if specific device or all devices affected
Test with direct ethernet connection
Clear device network settings and reconnect
Check for parental controls or MAC filtering
Verify DNS settings (try 8.8.8.8)
Test with different browser or device
Check for VPN or proxy interference

helpdesk_scenarios.description: Service suspended due to billing issues not caught by automated checks
helpdesk_scenarios.escalation_reason: Customer may have service suspension due to payment issues, disputed charges, or account status changes that require human intervention to resolve. Automated systems cannot access sensitive billing history or make payment arrangement decisions.
recommended_next_steps: Review full billing history and account status
Check for pending payments or failed auto-pay
Verify if service was suspended for non-payment
Offer payment arrangement options
Check for recent service cancellation requests
Review account notes for special circumstances

helpdesk_scenarios.description: Unusual technical issue requiring specialized expertise
helpdesk_scenarios.escalation_reason: Issue involves complex technical factors beyond standard troubleshooting: IPv6 configuration, CGNAT issues, port forwarding problems, business-class service requirements, compatibility with specific equipment, or infrastructure issues at ISP level.
recommended_next_steps: Escalate to network engineering team
Check for known service area issues
Review infrastructure status for customer's area
Investigate CMTS or DSLAM status
Check for recent network maintenance or upgrades
Coordinate with field operations if needed

booking_confirmation_format.reschedule_policy: Can reschedule up to 24 hours before appointment
booking_confirmation_format.service_guarantee: If technician doesn't arrive within time window, receive $20 credit

ticket_includes: Complete diagnostic history from all agents
Technical readings (ping, packet loss, modem status)
Priority level based on issue severity
